Issues.Title: [@angular/router] Nested redirection not working.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? No, it's not ### Description When router has `redirectTo` chain, redirection not working as expected. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [here is the repo](https://github.com/Seemspyo/ng-issue/tree/child-router) ## üî• Exception or Error `app-routing.module.ts` ```ts { path: 'depth-test', children: [ { path: '', redirectTo: '/depth-test/depth-1', pathMatch: 'full' }, { path: 'depth-1', component: Depth1Component, children: [ { path: '', redirectTo: '/depth-test/depth-1/child-depth-1', pathMatch: 'full' }, { path: 'child-depth-1', component: Depth1childComponent } ] } ] } ``` when navigate like below ```ts this.router.navigateByUrl('/depth-test'); ``` angular redirect to `/depth-test/depth-1`, not `/depth-test/depth-1/child-depth-1` as expected. Neither `routerLink` nor `Router.navigate` working. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: docs(forms): Deprecate legacy options for FormBuilder.group
Issues.Body:
Mark the {[key: string]: any} type for the options property of the FormBuilder.group method as deprecated. Using AbstractControlOptions gives the same functionality and is type-safe.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

The old option without type checking is described as legacy.

## What is the new behavior?

Marked the legacy options as a deprecated overload, for better tool support discouraging the non-type-safe pattern.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


## Other information

Tested that VSCode and internal Google tools only show a warning if the deprecated overload is used. Updating to the new options format simply requires renaming the property 'validator' to 'validators', and 'asyncValidator' to 'asyncValidators'. I don't know the correct format for documentation of an overloaded function, but I can update it to match the desired format.

Issues.Title: Add "find references" capability to Ivy integrated Language Service
Issues.Body:
Commit 1:
In order to map the pipe's `transform` method in the type check block
directly back to the pipe name in the template source, we need to
include the `BindingPipe`'s `nameSpan` with the `ts.methodAccess` for
the pipe's transform method.

Note that this is specifically relevant to the Language Service's "find
references" feature. As an example, with something like `-2.5 | number:'1.0-0'`,,
when calling "find references" on the 'number' pipe we want the text
span of the reference to just be `number` rather than the entire binding
pipe's source `-2.5 | number:'1.0-0'`.

Commit 2:
This commit adds "find references" functionality to the Ivy integrated
language service. The basic approach is as follows:

1. Generate shims for all files to ensure we find references in shims
throughout the entire program
2. Determine if the position for the reference request is within a
template.
  * Yes, it is in a template: Find which node in the template AST the
  position refers to. Then find the position in the shim file for that
  template node. Pass the shim file and position in the shim file along
  to step 3.
  * No, the request for references was made outside a template: Forward
  the file and position to step 3.
3. (`getReferencesAtTypescriptPosition`): Call the native TypeScript LS
`getReferencesAtPosition`. For each reference that is in a shim file, map those
back to a template location. For all other references, only include
those if the request was made from within a template (if it was made
from another location, we expect that the TypeScript LS plugin will
return those results and we don't want to duplicate them).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add "find references" capability to Ivy integrated Language Service" (#39768)

Issues.Title: fix(core): remove duplicated noop function
Issues.Body:
PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

The codebase currently contains several `noop` functions,
and they can end up in the bundle of an application.
A recent commit 6fbe21941d7ad1bab7441e1bf3c667ecffc7a359 tipped us off
as it introduced several `noop` occurrences in the golden symbol files.
After investigating with @petebacondarwin,
we decided to remove the duplicated functions.

## What is the new behavior?


This probably shaves only a few bytes,
but this commit removes the duplicated functions,
by always using the one in `core/src/utils/noop`.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(core): remove duplicated noop function" (#39761)

Issues.Title: fix(router): migration incorrectly replacing deprecated key
Issues.Body:
In #38762 we added a migration to replace the deprecated `preserveQueryParams` option with `queryParamsHandling`, however due to a typo, we ended up replacing it with `queryParamsHandler` which is invalid.

Fixes #39755.

Before deploying new version, we delete all files inside root, then we copy the new ones there. Service worker should have file installed in browser, so I don't understand why the error is on files that we manually deleted before deploying last build. I know that I deleted them from root site, but they should be in user browser service worker. Issues.Title: [docs-infra] The SW interferes with redirects from `rc.angular.io`
Issues.Body:
**Context:**
RC versions of Angular are deployed to the `rc-angular-io-site` Firebase site, which the `rc.angular.io` subdomain is connected to. When there is no active RC version, the `rc.angular.io` subdomain is redirected to `angular.io`. This redirect is configured via the Firebase console (and as such is a [301 redirect][1]).

##
**Problem:**
If a user has visited https://rc.angular.io/ during the RC period (when the subdomain was _not_ redirected to `angular.io`), they will have the SW activated for the `rc.angular.io` subdomain. When they try to visit https://rc.angular.io/ later, when there is no active RC (and the subdomain is supposed to be redirected to `angular.io`), the SW will serve the cached content and _not_ let the user be redirected to `angular.io`.

Furthermore, when the SW tries to retrieve any updates from the server (i.e. fetch the latest `ngsw.json` file), it will be redirected to `angular.io`, which will cause the request to fail due to CORS restrictions. The error will essentially look the same to the SW as if the client were offline. Thus, the SW can neither update nor realize it should unregister itself and stop serving content for `rc.angular.io`.

##
**Proposed solution:**
1. We will remove the redirect from `rc.angular.io` to `angular.io` from the Firebase console.
2. Whenever we deploy from the stable branch, we will check whether there is an active RC version (i.e. whether there is a patch branch with a higher major than the stable branch or the same major and a higher minor).

    Iff there is no active RC version, (in addition to the regular deployment) we will deploy the same content to the `rc-angular-io-site` Firebase site with the following tweaks:
    - Delete the `ngsw.json` file.  
        _This will cause the SW to unregister itself on the first visit to `rc.angular.io`._
    - Update the Firebase hosting configuration in `aio/firebase.json` to add a [302 redirect][2] for non-file requests (i.e. requests whose URL does not contain a `.` in the last path segment) to `angular.io`. For example:
        ```json
        {
          "type": 302,
          "regex": "(.*/[^./]*)$",
          "destination": "https://angular.io:1"
        }
        ```  
        _This will redirect users without a registered SW to `angular.io` (unless they are trying to access a file directly (for example `/foo.png`), which should be rare)._
    - Optionally, we could also update the Firebase hosting cngiuration to send a [Clear-Site-Data][3] header.

**Notes:**
- We need to refrain from redirecting files so that `ngsw.json` will not be attempted to be fetched from `angular.io` (and fail due to CORS). For the SW to unregister itself, it has to receive a 404 for `ngsw.json`.
- For users that have the SW installed for `rc.angular.io`, the proposed solution will still only redirect on the second navigation/reload. This is not ideal, but not a huge problem, esp. since (a) few people are expected to visit `rc.angular.io` and (b) we have the same content deployed to `rc.angular.io` and `angular.io`.

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status/301
[2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Status/302
[3]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Clear-Site-Data
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[docs-infra] The SW interferes with redirects from `rc.angular.io`" (#39760)

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

Encountered this issue when we try to upgrade an old Angular project from 8 to 11, and turn on Ivy

### Is this a regression?

Turn off Ivy works fine, no need to downgrade

### Description

CANNOT get the host component from a directive using `ContentChildren` when I upgrade my project to 11 and use Ivy.

Before that my project is using 8 and no Ivy, everything works fine.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

https://github.com/highestop/ng-demo-v11

Assume we have a custom Component `HelloComponent` and a Directive `HelloDirective`

In template we have

```html
<hello appHello></hello>
```

In `appHello` Directive I try to get the host component instance using `ContentChildren` like

```ts
export class HelloDirective implements AfterContentInit {
  @ContentChildren(HelloComponent, {descendants: true})
  contentComponents: QueryList<HelloComponent>;

  ngAfterContentInit() {
    console.log(this.contentComponents?.length);
  }
}
```

Clearly we have nothing in that query list

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12963908/99656538-f859e000-2a97-11eb-95b1-849c5a5fe1d4.png)

Though in earlier version before Ivy, everything works fine. Just need to set `"enableIvy": false`, and there it is

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12963908/99657279-ea588f00-2a98-11eb-8d8b-8e28d862d1a4.png)

Seems I can't reproduct it on StackBlitz, like https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-p7dx2x. Switching `enableIvy` doesn't work.

## üî• Exception or Error

CANNOT get the host component from a directive using `ContentChildren` when I upgrade my project to 11 and use Ivy.

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
```
Angular CLI: 11.0.2
Node: 14.15.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.0.1
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes
```
**Package Version:**
```
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1100.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1100.2
@angular-devkit/core            11.0.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.0.2
@angular/cli                    11.0.2
@schematics/angular             11.0.2
@schematics/update              0.1100.2

```

Issues.Title: Issue with locale sv.ts where jan. feb. '.' appears at the end
Issues.Body:
Please refer the below link where the highlighted line of code has this ['jan.', 'feb.', 'mars', 'apr.', 'maj', 'juni', 'juli', 'aug.', 'sep.', 'okt.', 'nov.', 'dec.'].

Issues.Body:

Please read https://angular.io/guide/security#report-issues on how to disclose security related issues.

üõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõë

Issue is not directly in angular code, so creating issue as opposed to following the link above.

***Problem:*** @angular/localize [v10.2.3](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/10.2.3/packages/localize/package.json#L33) and [v9.1.12](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/9.1.12/packages/localize/package.json#L37) both use [yargs@15.13.0](https://github.com/yargs/yargs/blob/v15.3.0/package.json#L31), which in turn uses y18n@^4.0.0.  y18n has the following Prototype Pollution [synk vulnerability](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-Y18N-1021887), with a remediation of upgrading y18n to v5..0.5 or higher.

[yargs@16.1.1](https://github.com/yargs/yargs/blob/v16.1.1/package.json#L52) upgrades to y18n@^5.0.5.  Is it possible to update the 9.x and 10.x lines of @angular/localize to use this higher version of yargs?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Synk Vulnerability SNYK-JS-Y18N-1021887 transitively in @angular/localize" (#39743)

Issues.Title: build: update to latest "yargs" package
Issues.Body:
The 15.x versions of `yargs` relied upon a version of `y18n` that
has a SNYK vulnerability.
This commit updates the overall project, and therefore also the
`localize` and `compiler-cli` packages to use the latest version
of `yargs` that does not depend upon the vulnerable `y18n`
version.
The AIO project was already on the latest `yargs` version and so
does not need upgrading.

Fixes #39743
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update to latest "yargs" package" (#39749)

Issues.Title: feat(language-service): watch extended configs for option changes
Issues.Body:
Currently the language service watches only the root config file of a
configured project for changes. Of course, for correctness, we should
watch for changes in any relevant config file.

This commit attaches file watchers to the project root config file, and
all known extended config files as determined by `readConfiguration`.
On a change to any config file, refresh the compiler options known by
the Angular LS, and attach file watchers for any newly-extended config
files.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(language-service): watch extended configs for option changes" (#39741)

Issues.Title: Make @ character removal optional when generating scoped libraries
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

While running ng generate library with a scoped package, let's say `@ui/mylib`, the generated folder is` ui/mylib`.
An explanation for this behavior was given here : [#646](https://github.com/angular/devkit/pull/646#issuecomment-380136599)
Unfortunately this breaks the behavior of much monorepo tools like lerna or oao. In a big project, you'll have several libraries that have dependencies on other ones in the same monorepo. To rebuild them all in order, you'll want to automatize launching `ng build` task on each library, by respecting the dependency graph (starting by the leaves).
Tools like lerna can do this, but will fail when looking at a folder that has the same name as the dependency in the package.json => @ui/mylib
Therefore these tools become unusable.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Make optional the removal of "@" character in the folder name, using a setting in angular.json for example ?


### Describe alternatives you've considered
No workaround found yet, unless I would consider redevelop a graph building system like lerna, just because of this folder glitch.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make @ character removal optional when generating scoped libraries" (#19439)

# üöÄ Feature request

### Command
- [x] update


### Description

Following the [docs](https://angular.io/cli/update), the command flag `--all` is **deprecated**. But why? 

### Describe the solution you'd like
I don't want to upgrade every single package. I created the app with one command and I want to update with one command.
`ng update --all` should update **all Angular packages** (only).  

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I don't know how `--all` works before. I just expected such command. I'm currently on `v11-next` and want to update the whole Angular deps to the stable `v11`. The CLI could collect all Angular scoped packages and ask for a batch of update all packages.

Issues.Title: Webpack v5 serve rebuild too slow
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description Webpack v5 serve rebuild too slow. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction * ng new angular-v11 * modify `app.component.html` and `app.component.scss` as below ```html
{{title}}
``` ```css .foo { color: blue; } ``` * yarn start * modify `color: blue;` to `color: red;` * see terminal and it will print ``` Initial Chunk Files | Names | Size styles.css | styles | 118 bytes 4 unchanged chunks Build at: 2020-11-19T04:17:28.338Z - Hash: 567ec1ad7718ef48fa96 - Time: 157ms ‚úî Compiled successfully. ‚úî Browser application bundle generation complete. ``` * add `"resolutions": { "webpack": "5.5.0" }` in `package.json` and `yarn install && yarn start` * modify `color: red;` to `color: black;` * see terminal and it will print ``` ‚†¶ Generating browser application bundles (phase: sealing)... Initial Chunk Files | Names | Size vendor.js | vendor | 2.05 MB polyfills.js | polyfills | 141.26 kB main.js | main | 11.21 kB runtime.js | runtime | 6.72 kB styles.css | styles | 118 bytes | Initial Total | 2.21 MB Build at: 2020-11-19T04:18:51.297Z - Hash: bb747ad918ba033c2fb2 - Time: 1739ms ‚úî Compiled successfully. ‚úî Browser application bundle generation complete. ``` In a small project, rebuild time vary from 157ms to 1739ms if we change webpack v4 to v5. In large project, the rebuild time will vary greatly. Also the `yarn ng serve --hmr` does not seem to work in webpack 5. ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: Schematic options jsonschema validation fails because of underscore in parsedArgs
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/21964542b481d359a1786dc7cae9d24414a00f70/packages/angular_devkit/schematics_cli/bin/schematics.ts#L262

When using `"additionalProperties": false` in the schema.json for a schematic, validation of arguments fails when invoked via the schematic CLI (in `@angular-devkit/schematics-cli@0.1001.4`) as it adds an `_` property to the options object.

    An error occured:
    Error: Schematic input does not validate against the Schema: {"_":[], ...}
    Errors:
      Data path "" should NOT have additional properties(_).
 

Earlier versions did not fail as the `parsedArgs._` property used to be deleted before invoking the schematic.

Issues.Title: Native Jest support as alternative testing solution
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
This feature request is for @angular/common


### Description
My suggestion is to support jest as default testing framework. Currently it's possible to use jest but it requires additional setup and an external dependency called `jest-preset-angular` to get not overwhelmed with configuration stuff. In my eyes jest brings some serious advantages over Karma.

- Parallel test execution
- Rerun only affected tests 
- Headless by default
- Well documented


### Describe the solution you'd like
Jest support without additional configuration setup. A possible solution could be a parameter on the `ng new` command which let the user decide the testing framework.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
Setup custom testing configuration for each project and use the external package `jest-preset-angular`

I've searched for similar issues here on GitHub but found nothing about this topic. Maybe we can discuss here if such a feature is useful or not. Is there anything I'm missing why there is no default support yet?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Native Jest support as alternative testing solution" (#19424)

Issues.Title: Give me the option to update an existing xlf file
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

- [X] extract-i18n

### Description
I'm a bilingual developer and always need to translate my apps.  Whenever I make any small change, I have to re-translate the whole xlf file. I do not use any translation services, I can speak both languages very well. I also do not see why I have to pay hundreds of dollars to use a translation app just so it can take an old xlf file and use the ID of it to update the fresh one produced each time by the angular cli.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Give me the option to update an existing xlf file. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered

- I've read on a close thread it would look weird to have translation in an xlf file produced by angular cli. This sounds more dogma than technical limitation. You can always give the option to do both.
- martinroob/ngx-i18nsupport
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Give me the option to update an existing xlf file" (#19418)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): disable output hashing when running dev-server
Issues.Body:
Using output hashing with the dev-server can cause memory leaks because the dev server does not know when to clean up the old files.

See: https://github.com/webpack/webpack-dev-server/issues/377#issuecomment-241258405

Closes #10411
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): disable output hashing when running dev-server" (#19423)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR when using HTTPS reverse proxy
Issues.Body:
With this change we set the publicHost to `0.0.0.0:0`, when it's not provided.

This solved issues where previously the publicHost needed to be specified directly to get around `ERR_SSL_PROTOCOL_ERROR` error when proxing https -> http.

NB: this was also the behaviour in version 10 https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/c252968225c0ecac6c4d8ee08e14ae64de8791a8/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/dev-server/index.ts#L170

Closes #19403

Issues.Title: angular.json fileReplacements not longer accept json
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/cli or compiler ?


### Is this a regression?

Yes, updating from 10.2.0.


### Description
`ng serve` doesn't work anymore if angular.json fileReplacements override a json file.

ex: 
`{
                  "replace": "src/assets/conf/config.json",
                  "with": "src/assets/conf/config.test.json"
                }`
prompt the following error in vscode and console: 
`String does not match the pattern of "\.([cm]?j|t)sx?$".`



## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

Couldn't find a angular/cli 11 on stackblitz.
Very simple to reproduce.

## üî• Exception or Error
```
Schema validation failed with the following errors:
  Data path ".fileReplacements[1]" should NOT have additional properties(replace).
  **Data path ".fileReplacements[1].replace" should match pattern "\.([cm]?j|t)sx?$".**
  Data path ".fileReplacements[1]" should match exactly one schema in oneOf.
```

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:** 11
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "angular.json fileReplacements not longer accept json" (#19414)

Issues.Title: Issues with symbol-observable: Property 'observable' must be of type 'symbol'
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] extract-i18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Is this a regression?

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: ....

Yes and no. Depending which other lib I use forgot to update to a newer `symbol-observable` version.

### Description

<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem...

This is something I get into more and more. One package depending on version x and the other on version y of the same lib. But this lib is not allowing different typed versions or in this case it is not even clear why different Observable approaches are used.

I have the following installed:

```
‚îú‚îÄ‚î¨ @angular/cli@11.0.1
‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ symbol-observable@2.0.3
‚îú‚îÄ‚î¨ @apollo/client@3.2.6
‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ symbol-observable@3.0.0
```

Running `serve` prints out:

```
ERROR in node_modules/symbol-observable/index.d.ts:6:14 - error TS2717: Subsequent property declarations must have the same type.  Property 'observable' must be of type 'symbol', but here has type 'unique symbol'.

6     readonly observable: unique symbol;
               ~~~~~~~~~~

  node_modules/rxjs/internal/symbol/observable.d.ts:4:18
    4         readonly observable: symbol;
                       ~~~~~~~~~~
    'observable' was also declared here.
```


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
<!--
Simple steps to reproduce this bug.

Please include: commands run (including args), packages added, related code changes.

If reproduction steps are not enough for reproduction of your issue, please create a minimal GitHub repository with the reproduction of the issue. 
A good way to make a minimal reproduction is to create a new app via `ng new repro-app` and add the minimum possible code to show the problem. 
Share the link to the repo below along with step-by-step instructions to reproduce the problem, as well as expected and actual behavior.

Issues that don't have enough info and can't be reproduced will be closed.

You can read more about issue submission guidelines here: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#-submitting-an-issue
-->

Its hard to find where the problem come from, since the TypeScript nor Angular-CLI prints any line where that type issue come from.
So before I take that time to create a repl I would like to hear if this is an easy fix and if this `symbol-observable` is still needed because I thought RxJS provides such already.

## üî• Exception or Error

```
ERROR in node_modules/symbol-observable/index.d.ts:6:14 - error TS2717: Subsequent property declarations must have the same type.  Property 'observable' must be of type 'symbol', but here has type 'unique symbol'.

6     readonly observable: unique symbol;
               ~~~~~~~~~~

  node_modules/rxjs/internal/symbol/observable.d.ts:4:18
    4         readonly observable: symbol;
                       ~~~~~~~~~~
    'observable' was also declared here.
```


## üåç Your Environment

```
Angular CLI: 11.0.1
Node: 14.15.1
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.0.0
... animations, cdk, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... material, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
... service-worker
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1002.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1100.1
@angular-devkit/core            10.2.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.0.1
@angular/cli                    11.0.1
@schematics/angular             11.0.1
@schematics/update              0.1100.1
rxjs                            6.6.2
typescript                      4.0.5
```

**Anything else relevant?**

Issues.Title: build: bump protractor from 5.4.3 to 7.0.0
Issues.Body:
Bumps [protractor](https://github.com/angular/protractor) from 5.4.3 to 7.0.0.
Changelog

Sourced from protractor's changelog.

7.0.0

  • (9d2e18e) refactor: use console.log instead of util.puts

    utils.puts is no longer available in Node.JS 12

  • (c281157) refactor: remove debugger and explore methods

    BREAKING CHANGE: Debugger and explore methods are not compatable with Node 8+. Use debugger keyword instead. See: https://goo.gl/MvWqFh

  • (7cdb978) build: update several dev packages that have security issues

  • (8e82835) build: update webdriver-manager

  • (a1fe5f2) ci: update tests to run on Node 10 and 12

  • (3fc9220) fix: prototype Pollution vulnerability through outdated yargs package

    BREAKING CHANGE:

    Node.Js version 6 and 8 are no longer supported. Please update to Node.Js 10+

    Closes #5431

5.4.4

Fixes

  • fix: security prototype pollution
Commits
  • 71771de release: 7.0.0
  • 9d2e18e refactor: use console.log instead of util.puts
  • c281157 refactor: remove debugger and explore methods
  • 7cdb978 build: update several dev packages that have security issues
  • 8e82835 build: update webdriver-manager
  • a1fe5f2 ci: update tests to run on Node 10 and 12
  • 3fc9220 fix: prototype Pollution vulnerability through outdated yargs package
  • a0ffa9b release: 5.4.4
  • 8b3ebf8 fix: security prototype pollution
  • 162f9e5 ci: Log sauce connect proxy to stdout, remove travis_wait, upgrade proxy to 4...

2020-11-18

v2.33.0

2020-11-01

Features

  • Add parameter to "watchChange" hook to denote if a change was an addition, update or deletion (#3841)
  • Add "closeWatcher" hook to allow plugins to clean up resources when the watcher is closed (#3841)
  • Add "this.getWatchFiles" function to plugin context to get the current set of watched files (#3841)

Pull Requests

  • #3841: Improved watcher hooks (@Amareis)
  • #3848: Add options hook to asyncpluginhooks (@intrnl)

2020-10-21

Pull Requests

Issues.Title: help(CdkTableDataSourceInput): Can't use async pipe for dataSource with strictTemplates
Issues.Body:
#### What are you trying to do?

Trying to use async pipe on an observable dataSource when strictTemplates are enabled:
```
<mat-table [dataSource]="vms$ | async">
```

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

When trying to compile with I am getting the following error:
```
Type 'Vm[] | null' is not assignable to type 'CdkTableDataSourceInput<Vm>'.
```
I have tried to use (vms$ | async)!, and other unlikely combinations to avoid the null return type, with no success. All results in syntax errors.

I appreciate any help with this!

#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. On the component: vms$: Observable<Vm[]> = new Observable<Vm[]>();
2. On the template: <mat-table [dataSource]="vms$ | async">
3. Disabling strictTemplates solves the problem

#### Environment

- Angular: 11.0.0
- CDK/Material: 11.0.0
- Typescript: 4.0.5
- Browser(s): N/A
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Ubuntu

Issues.Body:
<!--------

The Angular team can't provide general troubleshooting help. However, the extended community of
users can provide more help: 

StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/angular-material2
Gitter: https://gitter.im/angular/material2
Google Groups: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2

Issues should capture only bug reports and feature requests. However, we understand that 
it is not always clear whether an issue is caused by a bug or incorrect usage of a feature/component.

Most support requests will be automatically closed. If the answer is quickly obvious, though, we 
might be able to provide a brief answer.

-------->


#### What are you trying to do?

Hello, I'm trying to use the component `map-marker-clusterer` (https://github.com/angular/components/tree/master/src/google-maps/map-marker-clusterer) added 13 days ago in `google-maps`. 

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

It is in the repo, but it doesn't look to be in the compiled version : 
![Screenshot from 2020-11-19 11-31-44](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60105862/99695062-1c4b0080-2a5b-11eb-9cba-8dd34a7412f5.png)
![Screenshot from 2020-11-19 11-31-09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60105862/99695063-1c4b0080-2a5b-11eb-838f-5f25929acc76.png)
![Screenshot from 2020-11-19 11-30-48](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60105862/99695110-2e2ca380-2a5b-11eb-9fcf-1c6372e1bdd2.png)

I use the last version:

![Screenshot from 2020-11-19 11-32-13](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60105862/99695059-1bb26a00-2a5b-11eb-8982-2baa6c15d42f.png)

but it doesn't work...

#### Reproduction

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/google-maps/map-marker-clusterer/README.md

#### Environment

- Angular: 10
- CDK/Material: 10
- Browser(s): 10

What I'm doing wrong? Thanks!

Issues.Title: bug(Select): overlayPanelClass doesn't do anything
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Reopening https://github.com/angular/components/issues/21050 with more details

I need to place a custom class on the outermost overlay div. 
The issue I am having is that I am consuming an outside 3rd party resource for a modal which has a higher z-index then material. Within that modal is a form made with material components. The select overlay z-index is below the 3rd party modal.

I need the **overlayPanelClass** which is described in the Docs as: "_Class or list of classes to be applied to the menu's overlay panel._". 

The **panelClass** is described as "_Classes to be passed to the select panel. Supports the same syntax as ngClass._"

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue:

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-xtgy1y?file=src%2Fapp%2Fexample-component.html

Steps to reproduce:

1. Add overlayPanelClass on the mat-select component that sits within a 3rd party modal that has a higher z-index then the overlay. 

Expected Behavior
What behavior were you expecting to see?
I expected that the outermost overlay div to have that custom overlayPanelClass so I can adjust the z-index to be above the 3rd party modal. 

Actual Behavior
What behavior did you actually see?
No class is applied to the outermost overlay div.

Environment
Angular: 8
CDK/Material: Latest
Browser(s): Chrome latest
Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Select): overlayPanelClass doesn't do anything" (#21095)

Issues.Title: build: bump core-js from 2.6.10 to 3.7.0
Issues.Body:
Bumps [core-js](https://github.com/zloirock/core-js) from 2.6.10 to 3.7.0.
Changelog

Sourced from core-js's changelog.

3.7.0 - 2020.11.06
  • String#replaceAll moved to the stable ES, per June TC39 meeting
  • Promise.any and AggregateError moved to the stable ES, per July TC39 meeting
  • Added Reflect[@@toStringTag], per July TC39 meeting
  • Forced replacement of Array#{ reduce, reduceRight } in Chrome 80-82 because of a bug, #766
  • Following the changes in the upsert proposal, { Map, WeakMap }#emplace replace { Map, WeakMap }#upsert, these obsolete methods will be removed in the next major release
  • By the current spec, AggregateError#errors is own data property
  • Added correct iteration closing in the iteration helpers according to the current version of the proposal
  • process.nextTick have a less priority when Promise in the microtask implementation, #855
  • Fixed microtask implementation in engines with MutationObserver, but without document, #865, #866
  • Fixed core-js-builder with an empty (after the targets engines or another filtration) modules list, #822
  • Fixed possible twice call of window.onunhandledrejection, #760
  • Fixed some possible problems related multiple global copies of core-js, #880
  • Added a workaround for 3rd party Reflect.set polyfill bug, #847
  • Updated compat data:
    • Chrome up to 86
    • FF up to 82
    • Safari up to 14
  • Updated compat data mapping:
    • iOS up to 14
    • NodeJS up to 15.0
    • Electron up to 11.0
    • Samsung Internet up to 13.0
    • Opera Android up to 60
    • The rest automatically
  • Updated all required dependencies
3.6.5 - 2020.04.09
  • Updated Browserlist #755
  • Fixed setImmediate in Safari #770, thanks @dtinth
  • Fixed some regexp, thanks @scottarc
  • Added OPEN_SOURCE_CONTRIBUTOR detection in postinstall, thanks @scottarc
  • Added Drone CI in postinstall CI detection #781
3.6.4 - 2020.01.14
  • Prevented a possible almost infinite loop in non-standard implementations of some backward iteration array methods
3.6.3 - 2020.01.11
  • Fixed replacement of substitutes of undefined capture groups in .replace in Safari 13.0-, #471, #745, thanks @mattclough1
  • Improved compat data for old engines
3.6.2 - 2020.01.07
  • Fixed early implementations of Array#{ every, forEach, includes, indexOf, lastIndexOf, reduce, reduceRight, slice, some, splice } for the usage of ToLength
  • Added RegExp#exec dependency to methods which depends on the correctness of logic of this method (3.6.0-3.6.1 issue), #741
  • Refactored some internals
3.6.1 - 2019.12.25
  • Fixed a bug related Symbol with multiple copies of core-js (for 3.4.2-3.6.0), #736
  • Refactored some tools

... (truncated)

Commits
  • af4472e 3.7.0
  • eb279f4 update electron-to-chromium
  • 784cda1 fix some possible problems related multiple global copies of core-js, #880
  • fb28f12 fix possible twice call of window.onunhandledrejection, #760
  • ce6673a forced replacement of Array#{ reduce, reduceRight } in Chrome 80-82, #766
  • 8f75f24 [refactoring] introduce metadata.facade
  • 5a5a9f2 add es.reflect.to-string-tag to some more required entries
  • 3fd6d0b add Reflect[@@toStringTag]
  • 7fad6ac update the changelog
  • b61067d update some dependencies

Issues.Title: docs-bug(CdkPortal): @ViewChild() returns undefined when using *cdkPortal instead of <ng-template cdkPortal>
Issues.Body:
The [official doc says](https://material.angular.io/cdk/portal/overview#portals-in-practice): > > >

The content of this template is captured by the portal.

> > > > > >

> The content of this template is captured by the portal. >

> A component can use @ViewChild or @ViewChildren to get a reference to a CdkPortal. However, `@ViewChild('theElementRef')` binds to `undefined` when I use the `*cdkPortal` notation, while it works when I use `` I suspect `*cdkPortal` makes the element to leave the page before `afterViewInit()`. Maybe the documentation should encourage using the `` form instead. **Affected documentation page:** https://material.angular.io/cdk/portal/overview#portals-in-practice
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(CdkPortal): @ViewChild() returns undefined when using *cdkPortal instead of <ng-template cdkPortal> " (#21092)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "docs: use valid SCSS variables for example" (#21076)

Issues.Title: fix(material/autocomplete): closing immediately when input is focused programmatically
Issues.Body:
Each autocomplete has a `click` listener on the body that closes the panel when the user has clicked somewhere outside of it. This breaks down if the panel is opened through a click outside of the form field, because we bind the listener before the event has bubbled all the way to the `body` so when it does get there, it closes immediately.

These changes fix the issue by taking advantage of the fact that focus usually moves on `mousedown` so for "real" click the input will have already lost focus by the time the `click` event happens.

Fixes #3106.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/autocomplete): closing immediately when input is focused programmatically" (#21081)

Issues.Title: feat(material/datepicker): allow for datepicker toggle aria-label to be customized
Issues.Body:
Currently the only way to control the accessible label of a `mat-datepicker-toggle` is globally through the i18n provider. These changes add an input so it can be changed per instance.

Fixes #20590.

Issues.Title: build: ngOnChanges property access rule not working
Issues.Body:
Follow-up to #21074. We have a lint rule that flags property accesses like `changes.foo` where `changes` is a `SimpleChanges` object, because they'll break under Closure compiler. The rule depends on the TS type checker to identify the objects, but it seems like somewhere along the way, tslint changed how they construct the `Program` which removed the necessary type information.

These changes add a less complicated fallback which looks at whether the name of the receiver of a property access is the same as the name of the first method parameter.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: ngOnChanges property access rule not working" (#21075)

Issues.Title: Separate the datepicker validation and the picker constraint
Issues.Body:
Currently when we use the matDatePickerFilter to set the selectable dates for the datepicker, it automatically become the validator for the datepicker. However I believe there're valid use cases where picker selectable dates (constraints) don't necessarily equivalent to the validity of the datepicker value:
For example (see link below) I have a datepicker where at the moment of selection, user can only chose the dates from today forward, however it's possible that the current value of the datepicker is yesterday. This make the datepicker invalid even though it's considered valid. And the problem is there's no way to make the datepicker become valid for this case.
So I think that it's beneficial to be able to set the validation of the datepicker value independently from the picker filtering.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-datepicker-separation-of-picker-constraints?file=src%2Fapp%2Fdatepicker-overview-example.ts
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Separate the datepicker validation and the picker constraint" (#21073)

Issues.Title: perf(cdk/testing): reduce change detections when running parallel actions
Issues.Body:
Switches all of our `testing` code to use `parallel` instead of `Promise.all` which reduces the number of change detections that we'll trigger during tests.

Also adds more type overloads to `parallel`, because the previous types didn't allow the `values` function to return mixed value arrays which we had in ~15 instances. I've tried to reduce the amount of code by only implementing up to 5 overloads, but we may want to expand it to 9 like `Promise.all`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(cdk/testing): reduce change detections when running parallel actions" (#21071)
